xxl.connectivity.jama
Class KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.queries.QueryFeedbackSelectivityEstimator
      xxl.connectivity.jama.KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator
All Implemented Interfaces:
RangeQuery
public class KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator
extends QueryFeedbackSelectivityEstimator
implements RangeQuery

This class provides methods to estimate the selectivity of a simple range query which is represented by an array of doubles(left side closed, right side open).The domain of the values is divided into a specified number of intervals("buckets") and within each bucket, a linear spline is used to approximate the density of the values.The queries and their true selectivities are recorded and used to adjust the variables of each bucket to improve the estimation for frequently queried intervals.

A detailed discussion of the general idea is given in
[KW99]: Combining Histograms and Parametric Curve Fitting for Feedback-Driven Query Result-size Estimation. VLDB. 1999.

See Also:
QueryFeedbackSelectivityEstimator, RangeQuery

Nested Class Summary
protected  class KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator.PartitioningStrategy
          This class provides a skeleton implementation for the partitioning strategies used in [KW99] to partition (the phase of preprocessing of the algorithm) the data the histogram is based upon.

Constructor Detail

KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator

public KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator(double[] val,
                                int[] freq,
                                int numberOfBuckets,
                                int flag,
                                int numberOfQueries)
Constructs a new object of this class. The used PartitioningStrategy is specified by "flag": 0 = OptimalMerge; 1 = GreedyMerge;2 = GreedySplit.

Parameters:
val - double[] contains the values in ascending order
freq - double[] freq[i] contains the frequency of value val[i]
numberOfBuckets - int specifies the number of buckets, the domain is divided in
flag - int specifies the PartitioningStrategy
numberOfQueries - int specifies the number of queries to be processed before adjust is executed
